name: TISAS 26: Toronto international Street Art Summit 2026
description:
Check out our website for an overview deck to learn more about me, and both our organization and project.

In essence, TISAS 26 is a globally focused Street Art conference meets mural festival in one, with a speakers plus workshop series, live mural painting as a spectator sport, A film festival, family programming, music , and more. its big, to say the least! We're inviting over 100 of the world's best and brightest street artists to participate in painting, speaking and teaching, bringing new color city wide.

name: Hilary Hahn on Violin with Tom Poster on Piano

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Three-time Grammy Award-winning violinist Hilary Hahn melds expressive musicality and technical expertise with a diverse repertoire guided by artistic curiosity. She is currently artist-in-residence at both the Chicago Symphony Orchestra and London's Wigmore Hall, and is co-founder and vice president of artistic partnerships of the AI-music initiative Deepmusic.AI. Hahn is a prolific and celebrated recording artist whose 21 feature albums on Decca, Deutsche Grammophon, and Sony have all opened in the top ten of the Billboard charts.

Enjoy her program of Maurice Ravel: Violin Sonata No. 2 in G Major, M. 77, Bun-Ching Lam: Solitude d'automne, Lili Boulanger: Nocturne, Maurice Ravel: Pièce en forme de Habanera, M. 51, Claude Debussy: Sonata for Violin and Piano in G Minor, Scott Tixier: new duo work (North American premiere), and Gabriel Fauré: Violin Sonata No. 1 in A Major, op. 13.

name: Penderecki Quartet 40th Anniversary Concert

location.name: Jane Mallett Theatre, St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts

description:
Their journey began in Poland, where they won the prestigious Penderecki Prize at the 1986 National Chamber Music Competition in Łódź. 

Since 1991, they have served as Quartet-in-Residence at Wilfrid Laurier University, helping shape one of Canada's premier string programs. Known for their dedication to contemporary music, the Penderecki's have commissioned and performed over 100 new works. 

We invite you to enjoy their program of Krzysztof Penderecki: String Quartet No. 3 Leaves of an Unwritten Diary and Franz Schubert: Quintet in C major for Two Cellos, D. 956.

Arrive early to enjoy a pre-concert performance by Jacques Forestier, violin.
